decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing graveyard recursion and card draw to fuel a combo involving cards like Life from the Loam, Faithless Looting, and Conflagrate. By recurring creatures like Stinkweed Imp and Bloodghast, along with triggering effects from cards like Narcomoeba and Prized Amalgam, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a large army of creatures. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Collective Brutality and Darkblast, alongside additional graveyard recursion with Dakmor Salvage. The key strategy is to quickly fill the graveyard, recur creatures, and finish off the opponent with a powerful Conflagrate.

The main concept of this deck is to fill up your graveyard quickly using cards like Faithless Looting, Goblin Lore, and Burning Inquiry, in order to return powerful creatures like Vengevine and Flamewake Phoenix from the graveyard to the battlefield. The deck also aims to put pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Hollow One and Flameblade Adept, while utilizing burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Grim Lavamancer to control the board and deal direct damage. The overall goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast and resilient threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the board through counterspells, removal, and versatile creatures while also applying pressure through efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Lightning Helix. By utilizing flexible creatures like Spell Queller and Snapcaster Mage, along with powerful spells like Cryptic Command, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a clock with resilient threats like Celestial Colonnade. The mana base allows for flexibility in casting spells from multiple colors, ensuring that the deck can adapt to various matchups and situations.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly ramp up your mana with cards like Farseek and Search for Tomorrow, and then cheat out big threats like Primeval Titan and Woodfall Primus using cards like Through the Breach. The deck also includes Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle as a win condition by dealing damage with mountains entering the battlefield. The deck also includes some disruption in the form of Anger of the Gods and Relic of Progenitus to control the board and disrupt graveyard strategies.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly reanimate powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Worldspine Wurm using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Through the Breach. The deck also utilizes cards like Nourishing Shoal and Faithless Looting to help set up the combo, along with cards like Cathartic Reunion and Night's Whisper for card draw. The inclusion of Simian Spirit Guide and Desperate Ritual allows for fast mana to help cast the combo pieces earlier in the game. The deck aims to win through a quick and explosive reanimation strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This enables the player to cast powerful threats such as Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also includes control elements like Oblivion Stone and Relic of Progenitus to disrupt the opponent's strategy. By efficiently ramping into powerful threats and controlling the board, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

Utilize self-mill and graveyard recursion to quickly and consistently bring back key creatures such as Bloodghast, Narcomoeba, and Prized Amalgam, allowing for explosive combo plays and overwhelming board presence. Take advantage of powerful synergy between dredge cards like Stinkweed Imp and Life from the Loam to fill graveyard and trigger powerful abilities. Utilize cards like Cathartic Reunion and Faithless Looting to dig deeper into the deck and set up for game-winning plays. Utilize cards like Conflagrate and Scourge Devil to finish off opponents once the combo is established.

This deck focuses on quickly playing low-cost artifacts and creatures to overwhelm the opponent with fast damage output. Key cards like Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer enhance the power of creatures like Vault Skirge and Signal Pest. The ability to pump creatures with Arcbound Ravager and protect them with Etched Champion make it difficult for opponents to defend against the quick and aggressive playstyle. Utilizing mana acceleration from cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum, this deck aims to win the game as quickly as possible through aggressive attacks.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the synergy between Human creatures and disruptive elements to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By using cards like Thalia's Lieutenant to pump up the team and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Meddling Mage, the deck aims to apply pressure early on and maintain a strong board presence. With the help of Aether Vial for efficient creature deployment and Noble Hierarch for mana acceleration, the deck aims to be fast and aggressive, aiming to win before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays and overwhelming the opponent with Eldrazi creatures. It uses powerful Eldrazi cards like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer to apply pressure on the opponent while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Ghost Quarter. The deck includes cards like Karn Liberated and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger for late game power and inevitability. The mana base is designed to efficiently cast Eldrazi creatures, with cards like Expedition Map to ensure consistency. Overall, the deck aims to quickly close out games with its powerful threats.

The main theme of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Blood Moon and Relic of Progenitus while using removal spells like Skred and Lightning Bolt to maintain board control. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Stormbreath Dragon and Planeswalkers like Koth of the Hammer and Chandra to close out games. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's mana base and hand while steadily building towards a strong late-game presence to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using Human creatures. By utilizing cards such as Champion of the Parish, Thalia's Lieutenant, and Mantis Rider, the deck aims to quickly build a strong board presence and apply pressure early in the game. Cards like Collected Company provide additional creature support, while Thalia, Guardian of Thraben disrupts the opponent's spells. With a mix of mana acceleration from Noble Hierarch and Avacyn's Pilgrim, as well as removal spells like Path to Exile, the deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent.

This Amulet Titan deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using Amulet of Vigor to play powerful threats like Primeval Titan early in the game. The deck includes cards like Azusa, Lost but Seeking and Summoner's Pact to help search for key pieces. The main win condition is to tutor for Hive Mind and force opponents to copy game-winning spells. The deck also includes utility lands like Bojuka Bog and Ghost Quarter to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With careful planning and efficient mana production, this deck can create explosive turns and overwhelm opponents.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of aggressive Goblin creatures and burn spells. By utilizing cards like Goblin Guide and Legion Loyalist to deal early damage and Goblin Bushwhacker and Reckless Bushwhacker to pump up the team, the goal is to finish the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize. Goblin Grenade and Lightning Bolt provide additional reach to close out the game. The key strategy is to maintain a fast and relentless assault to overpower the opponent and secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the game while utilizing the Death's Shadow mechanic to gain advantage. By combining efficient removal spells, hand disruption, and card draw, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying threats like Death's Shadow, Gurmag Angler, and Tasigur, the Golden Fang to quickly close out the game. Additionally, the deck benefits from graveyard synergies and efficient creatures like Snapcaster Mage to ensure flexibility and consistency in its gameplay.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays using the Human creature type to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By utilizing cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish to boost the power of the Human creatures, combined with disruptive cards like Reflector Mage and Meddling Mage, it aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. With mana fixing options like Unclaimed Territory and Aether Vial, as well as protection from counterspells with Cavern of Souls, the deck aims to maintain a strong board presence and push for a fast victory.
